byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Rick Lyman from Molyvos, Greece. Nabih Bulos contributed reporting from Molyvos, and Joseph Goldstein from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and RICK LYMAN

abstract: United Nations reports about 64,000 Afghan refugees entered Greece in October, compared with 27,500 in September, and many are headed to Germany; they face increased difficulty in staying  year or more, as Germany is hardening its stance against Afghan refugees.
lead_paragraph: Germany’s tougher stance toward migrants from Afghanistan is emerging as a big test of Europe’s willingness to absorb people from the world’s most troubled regions.

headline.main: Afghans Arriving in Germany Find the Welcome Is Wearing Thin
headline.print_headline: Afghans Find a Tepid Welcome in Germany

snippet: Germany’s tougher stance toward migrants from Afghanistan is emerging as a big test of Europe’s willingness to absorb people from the world’s most troubled regions.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
